dt: {bc}characterized by or reflecting {d_link|economy|economy:1} in the use of resources

pt: {sc}sparing{/sc} {sc}frugal{/sc} {sc}thrifty{/sc} {sc}economical{/sc} mean careful in the use of one's money or resources. {sc}sparing{/sc} stresses abstention and restraint.
{sc}frugal{/sc} implies absence of luxury and simplicity of lifestyle.
{sc}economical{/sc} stresses prudent management, lack of wastefulness, and use of things to their best advantage.

quotes.t: His meals are the {qword}frugal{/qword} fare of the poor: tea, bread, yogurt, a bit of cheese, vegetables.
In a {qword}frugal{/qword} white frame house of tiny rooms that shook with every passing freight train, five boys of German immigrant background had grown up at the turn of the twentieth century.
Like {qword}frugal{/qword} cooks everywhere, Cajun cooks from generations past found plenty of ways to use every part of the animals they raised.

et: Middle French or Latin; Middle French, from Latin {it}frugalis{/it} virtuous, frugal, from {it}frug-, frux{/it} fruit, value; akin to Latin {it}frui{/it} to enjoy
shortdef: characterized by or reflecting economy in the use of resources
